title: allow to specify SSHRI within DATALAD_TESTS_SSH which would be used for tests
body:
ATM I think we are using `localhost` and `datalad-test`:
```
$> git grep ssh.*datalad-test
datalad/support/tests/test_annexrepo.py:    socket_1 = opj(ssh_manager.socket_dir, 'datalad-test')
datalad/support/tests/test_annexrepo.py:    gr.add_remote("ssh-remote-1", "ssh://datalad-test" + remote_1_path)
datalad/support/tests/test_sshconnector.py:    manager.get_connection('ssh://datalad-test').open()
tools/ci/prep-travis-forssh.sh:ssh -v datalad-test exit

$> git grep ssh://localhost
datalad/distribution/tests/test_target_ssh.py:                sshurl="ssh://localhost",
datalad/distribution/tests/test_target_ssh.py:    eq_("ssh://localhost", source.repo.get_remote_url("local_target"))
datalad/distribution/tests/test_target_ssh.py:            sshurl="ssh://localhost",
datalad/distribution/tests/test_target_ssh.py:            sshurl="ssh://localhost" + target_path,
datalad/distribution/tests/test_target_ssh.py:        eq_("ssh://localhost" + target_path,
datalad/distribution/tests/test_target_ssh.py:            sshurl="ssh://localhost",
datalad/distribution/tests/test_target_ssh.py:            target_pushurl="ssh://localhost" + target_path,
datalad/distribution/tests/test_target_ssh.py:        eq_("ssh://localhost" + target_path,
datalad/distribution/tests/test_target_ssh.py:                sshurl="ssh://localhost" + target_path_,
datalad/support/tests/test_annexrepo.py:    ar.add_remote('ssh-remote-2', "ssh://localhost" + remote_2_path)
datalad/support/tests/test_gitrepo.py:    url = "ssh://localhost" + abspath(remote_path)
datalad/support/tests/test_gitrepo.py:    url = "ssh://localhost" + abspath(remote_path)
datalad/support/tests/test_gitrepo.py:    url = "ssh://localhost" + abspath(remote_path)
datalad/support/tests/test_sshconnector.py:    c1 = manager.get_connection('ssh://localhost')
datalad/support/tests/test_sshconnector.py:    ok_(manager.get_connection('ssh://localhost') is c1)
datalad/support/tests/test_sshconnector.py:    c1 = manager.get_connection('ssh://localhost')
datalad/support/tests/test_sshconnector.py:    manager.get_connection('ssh://localhost').open()
datalad/support/tests/test_sshconnector.py:    remote_url = 'ssh://localhost'
```

so I thought we should unify to use e.g. localhost by default and then anything provided in that env variable if it starts with ssh:// ;)
